page.description: The oAuth Provider Definition in a JSON configuration file with a .json extension that is stored in a oAuthProviders folder in the WebProject, the system oAuth Providers are stored in the oAuthProviders folder under the EXE path.

section.title: oAuth 2.0 definitions
section.description: Google is a good example of an oAuth 2.0 endpoint. The JSON profile information example below shows the settings.

item.name: token_path
item.description: Endpoint to exchange code for access token.

item.name: oauth2_bearer
item.description: Template for filling in Access token from result.

item.name: oauth2_scope
item.description: Scopes required for login information (if using the provider for external login).

item.name: getProfileInfo
item.description: Endpoint to retreive Profile Information (if using the provider for external login).

item.name: ProfileIdVariable
item.description: Field returned by the getProfileInfo endpoint that idenities the user for external login.
